The City of Port Moody is seeking a detail orientated and organized individual with excellent interpersonal and communication skills for a regular, full-time opportunity as a Recreation Accounting Clerk.
Working closely with the Finance Department, the Recreation Accounting Clerk is responsible for performing basic accounting functions such as invoicing, financial reporting, balancing, reconciling, and processing refunds and revenue generated from various recreation facilities.
This position also coordinates purchase orders, service agreements, contractor compliance and work orders for Community Services, provides administrative support for the Health and Safety Committee, trains staff on cash handling procedures and communicates information to the general public in regard to refunds and receivables.
Basic Qualifications:
Grade 12 supplemented by additional courses in office administration and accounting plus related experience;
2 to 3 years of accounting, cash handling and Moneris experience;
General understanding of purchasing processes, and contract administration;
Proficiency in MS Office;
Ability to work well independently and multi-task in a busy environment;
Excellent customer service and communication skills;
Knowledge of PerfectMind or similar registration systems would be an asset; and
Knowledge and understanding of community recreation would be an asset
Please note that employment with the City of Port Moody is subject to the receipt of a satisfactory police information check and a satisfactory driver's abstract.

Title: Virtual Controller - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Are you looking to gain valuable, diverse, hands on experience overseeing the day-to-day finance needs of growing startups across Canada? Are you ready to take the next step in your career?
This is an exciting time to join our fast growing startup and play a key role in shaping who
FrontierCFO
becomes. Intrigued? Read on…
The Role
FrontierCFO
is looking to add a Virtual Controller to oversee day-to-day controllership services to startups across Canada and the US.
Ideal for emerging managers, your role will be to nurture the relationship with your client base, adapting to their changing needs while they grow, as well as mentoring and guiding team members on how to thrive in their roles.
You will gain insight into the financial needs and challenges of startups at different stages of growth and scale, manage a team of associates, and work with the Virtual CFO to dive into more difficult and strategic issues.
Key responsibilities will include:
- Lead month-end meetings with clients to discuss the company’s performance, variances from the budget, and overall updates.
- Deliver complex advisory services alongside the Virtual CFO on your team, such as due diligence for an acquisition, raising funds, building out financial models, and other financial planning and analysis.
- Mentor and guide the Virtual Accounting Associates on your team in preparing investor reporting, forecasting updates, and cash management analysis.
- Manage the full-cycle accounting for your client base by working closely with the Virtual Bookkeeping Associates and Virtual Accounting Associates on your team.
Who we’re looking for:
- You’ll bring with you experiences like 3+ years in full-cycle accounting or public practice accounting — ideally experiencing high growth in a remote environment.
- You have an intuitive communication style with team members and clients that contributes to our culture of trust, respect, and reliability — especially when working remotely and asynchronously.
- You have proficient knowledge of cloud accounting tools and can apply an integrated tech stack to optimize efficiencies and minimize manual processes (e.g. Xero, Hubdoc, Expensify).
- You have an uncanny ability to organize a high volume of data and information — while maintaining remarkable attention to detail and accuracy.
- You self-manage your schedule, priorities and deadlines in a flexible way that aligns with your team.
- You find meaning in working in a tight-knit team and thrive when collaborating with and learning from those around you.
Interview Process
We take a short but deep approach to our hiring process - there are only 3 steps, but they are all a little more involved than other companies:
- Initial Video Call - usually lasting about 30 mins, you will meet with our People Operations Manager to discuss the role and ask any questions you might have
- Case Study - there will be a mock client request to review and prepare information for a call. This will first take place with someone acting as our mock client and then a follow up to discuss the case study and chat more about the role
- Team Interview - a call with a couple members of the team to have the opportunity to get to know some people you will be working with, and ask questions from people who already work here.
Sound like something you are interested in? Apply now!

Description:

An iconic brand and one of the most inspirational not-for-profit organizations on this planet – The Canadian Red Cross (CRC), is seeking a Finance Analyst to join our Finance team.
You want to be part of the world’s largest humanitarian network? You have a passion for helping others, and want to work with other dedicated individuals? By applying, you are taking a big first step to be part of an exciting organization that makes a huge difference in the lives of Canadians here at home and abroad. What are you waiting for?
At the Canadian Red Cross, we help people and communities in Canada and around the world in times of need and support them in strengthening their resilience. We are committed to having an accessible, diverse, and inclusive work environment where people with all abilities, ethnicities, gender identities and expressions, nationalities, religions, and sexual orientations can reach their full potential. All qualified persons, particularly Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, women, veterans, and others who share our values and contribute to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace are encouraged to apply.
As a Finance Analyst you will:
Regularly analyse transactions and balances to ensure they are accurate, complete, and reasonable and identify any errors or omissions and prepare correcting journal entries as required.
Calculate various monthly reallocations and prepare the related journal entries.
Prepare the monthly project module to general ledger reconciliations and identify any errors or omissions and prepare correcting journal entries as required.
Determine the monthly open purchase orders for projects and prepare the related accrual journal entry.
Monitor outgoing project travel advances against returned expense claims and repayments via balance sheet account reconciliation and notify management of aged advances and concerning balances.
Prepare monthly inventory and accrued payables balance sheet account reconciliations.
Identify deficiencies in transactional processes and recommend areas of improvement.
Ensure the monthly general ledger process occurs as scheduled.
Perform other transactional and account reviews and reporting as requested by management.
Support internal and external audits as needed.
Cross-train with other analysts to provide back up.
What we are looking for:
The incumbent must have the commitment to the Fundamental Principles of the Red Cross Movement and model the core competencies of the CRCS: team excellence, service excellence, accountability and results focused.
Completion of a certificate or degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field.
General knowledge and understanding of accounting theory, techniques and policies.
Demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Time management and organizational skills reflected in the ability to prioritize and multi-task.
Strong attention to detail, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work both independently with minimal supervision, and collaboratively within a team.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively.
This position requires a satisfactory Canadian criminal record reference check.
Full vaccination against COVID-19 is mandatory for this position and operation (the CRC will however adhere to its duty to accommodate those who are unable to be fully vaccinated for a reason related to a human right protected ground)
The Canadian Red Cross is an organization guided by our fundamental principles of humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity and universality. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you require accommodation measures during any phase of the hiring process, please notify us as soon as possible. All information received in relation to accommodation requests will be kept confidential.
